TopicTitle: Schematics, cross sections, and cutaway diagrams

Articles.Content:
I remember that when I was very young, I had an Incredible Cross Sections-style book all about spacecraft that showed cutaway diagrams of things like the Saturn V rocket, the different Apollo modules, the Space Shuttle, and a few others. I remember it being the most awesome book ever at the time, and I would spend hours looking at the diagrams and imagining what it would be like to ride inside one of those vehicles or see them in action.

I think it would be cool if, somewhere in the game, we had something along the same lines, whether 3D cutaways or simple 2D line diagrams, for a selection of parts in the game (like the crew capsules). They could be useful as additional loading screens, background images for as-yet unimplemented features in the game, or even as part of an unlockable "bonus gallery" once the full game is out once and for all.

To give a few examples of what I'm talking about, here's a Wikimedia gallery full of cutaway diagrams for real-world spacecraft, and another gallery specific to the Soyuz class of vessels.

I'm sure some of them would, but that's not really what I'm talking about.

It's actually on the planned features list on the wiki...and I can remember Harvester talking about an exploded and/or schematic view once. At least, I think it was Harvester talking about it. It was one of them dudes, at least >.>

Anyways, it'll certainly be good, but I get the feeling that it's kind of a low priority. I forget what they said the benefits would be...something to do with having more control over staging or something. I don't know, it was quite a while ago.
